title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: NWS Boston predicts heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding for southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island from Sunday night to Monday.
Meteorologists expect snowfall of 10-15 inches in metro Boston, with the South Shore and Cape likely to receive a foot or more.
Concerns are raised about power outages due to heavy, wet snow and high winds, especially in southeastern Massachusetts.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declined to comment on Sam Kennedy's remarks about his departure from the Red Sox.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy claimed Bregman left because he wasn't committed to staying in Boston.
Bregman signed with the Chicago Cubs, valuing their offer's no-trade clause over Boston's offer.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Robert Duvall's performance in 'Apocalypse Now' (Redux) is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex.
'Blue Moon,' a biopic of lyricist Lorenz Hart, directed by Richard Linklater, is now on Netflix.
'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2, starring Jennifer Garner, is available on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora states Marcelo Mayer must earn his spot on the Opening Day roster this spring training.
Mayer, 23, needs to prove his offensive capabilities; he batted .228 with four home runs in 136 plate appearances last season.
Mayer, free from injuries this spring, is primarily practicing at second base, competing with newcomer Caleb Durbin in the infield.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Nor'easter expected Sunday night to Monday with heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding possible in southeast MA/RI.
Meteorologists predict snow could start Sunday night, with potential for over a foot on the South Shore/Cape.
Power outages are a concern due to heavy wet snow and strong winds; conditions to become clearer in 12-24 hours.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court in-person for the first time since allegedly killing her three children in 2023.
Clancy, accused of murder and strangulation, communicated briefly with the judge and mostly remained unexpressive during the hearing.
Clancy's defense argues her actions were due to heavy medication and postpartum illness; she plans to use an insanity defense.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly voted 10-5 to propose a real estate transfer fee on sales over $1 million.
The fee, ranging from 0.5% to 4%, aims to generate $60 million annually for housing initiatives.
90% of the revenue would go to towns while 10% supports a year-round housing trust.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police are monitoring a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' scheduled for 3 p.m. Friday for public safety.
The event, similar to car meetups, could involve large crowds, vehicle burnouts, and was linked to previous disturbances.
Gov. Maura Healey condemned such meetups, previously providing a $14 million safety grant to aid prevention efforts.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven members of the Brockton-based Harvard Street Gang face federal drug and firearms charges, authorities announced.
Investigators seized 25 firearms and large quantities of drugs during searches across Eastern Massachusetts, including Brockton and Randolph.
The gang, including affiliates, has been linked to extensive drug distribution, firearms offenses, and violent crimes since 2019.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Boston Celtics to join the Golden State Warriors citing reasons beyond basketball.
Salary considerations and a desire for a fresh start influenced Horford's decision to leave Boston.
Horford spent seven seasons with the Celtics, winning his only NBA title with the team.
